extension.searchTitle: FINANCIAL INSTITUTION CUSTOMER PROTECTION ACT OF 2015; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 21

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 766, to provide requirements for the appropriate Federal banking agencies when requesting or ordering a depository institution to terminate a specific customer account, and to provide for additional requirements related to subpoenas issued under the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989, by a yea-and vote of 250 yeas to 169 nays, Roll No. 63.
